Anyways, aside from this meal totally messing with my mind, if you are someone who wants to get as close as possible to eating a real chicken without eating a chicken, then this Garden is the garden of paradise for you. Tea is really good, I love the indoor-outdoor setting (makes me feel like I'm somewhere tropical instead of SF, wearing gloves while I eat my lunch), they bring you a lovely assortment of additions for your meal and it's plentiful food for the price. The non pseudo bird meals I have had there (mainly stir-fried tofu dishes of course) were good as well, though slightly oilier than I might have liked. But if  my fake chicken ever has fake bones in it I'm done.
author: Hallie R.

description: I came here a couple of weeks ago for dinner . I had the bun bo hue and the chicken spring rolls . They were both decent but not extraordinary delicious ....
author: Eileen L.

description: The Pho here is good, though honestly the chicken in it scares me a bit. Their Curry chicken is good. Atmosphere is fine, a good place for a quick and cheap in-and-out meal. The staff is nice.
author: Kasi B.

description: This was the first place we saw before going to our appointment. It was super hot so we just decided to check this place out. You walk in and you have the option of eating in the main area or the back area which is cool, I guess.  The staff were always in a hurry and not as attentive but whatever.  I wasn't too hungry so I opted for dessert which was the only thing on the dessert menu: fried banana with coconut ice cream.  The ice cream was good but the fried banana--definitely have had better.  Good for convenience but if you want something a little better go somwhere else.
author: Mel P.

description: The food is fresh and delicious. I really like the BBQ pork Vermicelli. We were trying to decide if we wanted fresh spring rolls or imperial. rolls. What the hell, we went with the imperial rolls. They were crisp and hot. The menu has a great selection. The service was a bit slow, there was a major lunch rush plus we did have a large party.
author: Jennifer S.

description: Food was to salty. I had to take a 2hr nap right after! The power of the msg....
author: Alex V.

description: At first I was skeptical about this place. I kept driving by it and thinking it looked horribly out of place. However, since they deliver (!!) I had to try it.  They have a lot of interesting vegetarian food, including veggie pho and soy chicken in a curry and vegetable sauce.  Beware, the soy chicken is a big filet and actually looks like a chicken breast, but I promise, it's good.  I've been looking for a good Vietnamese delivery place for awhile, and I finally found it :)
author: Jennifer C.

description: A friend recommended this place and I decided to stop in for some pho before heading to Slow Club for drinks.  We had the pho, the black & bean squid, and the thinly-sliced raw beef appetizer.  Everything was tasty, the menu is quite large, and I'd like to come back and try more stuff.  The staff was friendly and service was quick.  We went there on a Wednesday night and saw other Vietnamese people eating there.  It was a little empty though.  I'm not sure how their business is since they're tucked away in an obscure corner of the East Mission/Potrero Hill border and not near any major restaurants, but they're near Mission Cliffs if you're looking for something to eat after climbing.
author: Asteridae A.

description: I like this place. It's clean, it's bright and the food's decent. The fact that it's within walking distance to work is a nice because, otherwise, I'd never come here. The pho is ok. There's nothing stellar about the broth or the meat quality, or presentation, but the folks are really nice here. I've tried the Vietnamese crepes (pretty good but too much bean sprouts), the bun salads (big and tasty but lacks fresh herb variety), and the hu tieu (pretty good but like the pho, not memorable).  The prices are a bit higher than what I'm used to but eh, there's really not many dining choices around this neighborhood and I've never had food poisoning.
author: TaDao V.

description: Having been a frequenter of Hung Yen years ago, I used to stop in for their spring rolls.   Since I was in the neighborhood at lunchtime, I figured I'd try out Evergreen's spring rolls.  I figured it's hard to go wrong on spring rolls, right?  Wrong!  The roll itself was not  flavorful.  It was missing both texturally and in flavor .  Unfortunately, the peanut sauce had absolutely no zing and seemed too sweet.  Disappointing.
author: Julie T.

description: I used to go here nearly once/week for the chicken bun and thai/vietnamese coffee when I worked down the street.  They have both a thai and vietnamese menu (very versatile!).  On occasion, they even have live music.  They have a nice outdoor seating area.  The wait staff are all very nice, very pleasant, and provide good service (for either take-out or eat in).  I miss this place.
author: Nancy K.

description: I eat here 2x a week and am consistantly satisfied.  Trusted favorites are basil chicken & #33
author: Brett N.

description: My husband and I get take out here regularly, and we always get the same things. Good pho, tasty fresh summer rolls (shrimp or tofu), decent vermicelli dishes (imperial roll), and DELICIOUS shrimp salad--it's Goi Tom, number 23.  I think the shrimp is even fake, but somehow they make the simple shredded cabbage, crushed peanuts, and fish sauce together taste extremely appetizing.
author: Jen C.

description: "Has anyone ever ate here or ever tried?  I would say NOT since it is absolutely the BEST VIETMANESE with Thai on the side restaurant and it is cheap too and the people are sooooo cute:  You will love it...there is no reason not to eat here, will you give it a try?
author: Tamara M.

description:
Service is quick it took about 10 minutes to get my food from the take out counter.
The eggplant chicken and red pepper dish that I ordered was very bland, and the chicken was quite dry. I'm very disappointed. 
I should have just walked the other direction to El Tepa for the millionth time. 
The Thai iced tea gets my 2 stars. The quick service is no use to me if the food isn't any good right?
author: Nico L.

description:
not the best thai food in the world. definitely not. i ordered bun. and ive had bun before at this place in san diego (pho ca dao) and that bun is sooo much better. meat portions were low. carrots tasted weird. chairs were uncomfortable. smelly. blah blah blah. i just didnt like it!

the only plus about this place was that the food was served super quick. but i guess that goes without saying for most vietnamese/asian restaurants. ya feel me?
author: A. V.

description:
3.50 stars

i used to live really close to evergreen so my friends and i would go there at least once a week for lunch or dinner.  i very much prefer the vegetarian style vietnamese dishes versus the dishes with meat or seafood on the evergreen menu.  

my favorite dishes are... 
~summer rolls (both the shrimp and veggie ones)
~tofu salad
~ pho noodle soup with vegetables
~clay pot sour and spicy vietnamese soup (it's a veggie version of canh chua).  i think this one is more of an acquired taste.  i love it!  
~veggie vermacelli noodle salad with fried spring rolls
~spicy string beans with tofu

all the veggie stuff is great!  the beef pho is OK here, not the best in the city.
author: Wendy S.

description:
well evergreen garden dont uses MSG (if they do maybe just a little?) not like all the other pho places
i dont get thirsty after eating there but if im at other pho places i get REALLy thirsty!. 
maybe some of you guys were just having a bad stomach day. i never had any of the symptoms of what people were talking about.

anyways. i really like this place. great food! i been here more than 5 times and no issues. maybe the place needs a little remodel but i guess that makes them unique
i recommend the fried spring roll, plate of raw meats (not sure whats the name of that dish), the clay pot and of course the pho.

they also do Delivery
author: Jess I.

description: Not the best Pho in town nor the cleanest, but it's a quick fix if you're craving Vietnamese food in the area. They are also pretty fast during lunch. I usually get their Pho and Vermicelli which are consistently tasty. On more than one occasion, I found myself eating a bowl of Vermicelli with a surprise ingredient... a strand of hair not belonging to myself. This ultimately ended my patron-ship of this place. If you are wary of cleanliness stay away from this place.
author: R B.

description: A star for convienence, another for being spacious, and another because I'm in a good mood.  The food is nothing praise worthy.
author: Michelle C.

description: Yum pho that's close to work.  Just finished having lunch here.  I ordered the #1 pho.  I would still prefer eating my Pho at Pho Saigon in daly city, but Evergreen is not bad.  The place is nestled at the corner.  Lots of staff, quick service, lots of seatings, price is decent ( $6.95 one size pho ).  Would come here again, but I dont think I would be ordering Pho from here.
author: Mimi S.

description: Vegetarian dish was completely bland. Dinner presentation lackluster. Cleanliness of the facilities seemed questionable.
author: Jade P.

description: I was working on-site at a vendor on Folsom btwn 17th and 18th streets, so I got a chance to check out Evergreen Garden for lunch. This place used to by Hung Yuen, and it was quite rundown with ok Pho. Whether it's new owners or just a new name, the place has been spruced up quite a bit. The patio is now really nice, whereas before it was a spot being used for storage of tables and chairs. The food: Decent pho, fresh springrolls, real drip Cafe Sua Da. It'll do in a pinch, but I still head over to the Sunset for Pho Hoa Hiep every weekend even though Evergreen's much much closer to home.
author: Scott M.

description: My new favorite lunch spot.  I'm going to give it 4 starts since I've only had two things, and might not get anything else because those two are so good...but we'll see. If I explore and find that other plates are just a good, I'll move them up to 5 starts. Good polite service, and out door seating is nice as well.
author: Chris L.

description: Service can be spotty -- they forgot my dish when we were w/ a large group.  The food is a 3 star average.  I'm not sure if quick service the other times makes up for the forget my dish time, but what the hell, I'll be generous.  The outside area is decent.  Overall, I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here.
author: Avi H.

description: Pretty on point Vietnamese food here.  The pho is more authentic than many other Viet restaurants in the city because of its aromatic broth, the rolls, both imperial and spring, are good, and the crepe is crispy with the right flavors.  A cool, casual spot for some pretty authentic food.
author: Linda P.

description:
I had driven past this place multiple times, and since I never saw anyone in it, I thought it was a front...That said, my boss and I went here for lunch the other day, and surprise surprise, it was packed!
If it had been a sunny day, I would have sat in the outdoor patio, but being a cold foggy day we sat inside. The decor is a little cheesy, and when my boss went to pick up a figurine of a baby, he found it was glued to the velvet cloth....how tacky...
On to the food, we both were hungry so we ordered the pork chops, which came with two imperial rolls. I found the pork chops to be a little overly sweet, and the imperial rolls a little over battered. The pile or rise was huge, and I have no idea how anyone could get through the pork chops, the rice and the imperial rolls and still be able to walk.
Overall, I'll be back because its within walking distance of work, but I wouldn't make a special trip out here to eat.
author: Bianca L.

description:
gosh, sometimes i feel like such a bitter ragger...i really do love food and i really do appreciate good cuisine. but i guess i am fundamentally a food snob and even more specifically a sushi and vietnamese cuisine snob.

there is really no reason to dine at evergreen unless like me, you work or live in the area and are desperate for a bowl of pho or other vietnamese dish. 

it's not that the pho here lacks authenticity. the main problem - actually a common one - is that the pho broth lacks flavor. yes, it does hit the spot for me if that is what my taste buds insist on that day at work, but i always leave with a distinct feeling of disappointment. 

the one really good thing about evergreen, however, is the outside patio. 

other than that, you're better off pho hunting in the tenderloin, sunset, or richmond.
author: Baochi N.

description: This place has gone up and down in quality over the years, but when I ate there yesterday they were at the top of their game. My meal was good and everybody I saw in the lunchtime crowd seemed to be really enjoying their food too. It was one of those days when you want to ask all the people around you the name of the dish they ordered so you can order it next time.
author: Laurie W.

description:
OK - this was my first experience with Vietmanese so I can't compare this place with other Vietmanese places, but what I had was GREAT!

I've been wanting to try pho for a long time and since I'm going to Ho Chi Minh CIty next month I thought I better hurry up and get on it. 

I ordered a #4 (rare beef pho), the rolls with peanut sauce and the Vietmanese pancake.  I'll pass next time on the pancake, but everything else was spot on.  

The delivery was super fast, and the pho came with all of the side fixings separated out so I could do it all up myself.... and the quantity was enormous.  Plenty enough for 3 to 4 servings.  All of the veggies and herbs were uber-fresh too.  

All of this for sub-$20 before tip?  Count me IN!!!

(The only issue was that they forgot to deliver the diet coke I ordered, but it wasn't included on the bill either. No harm no foul I guess...)
author: K. K.

description:
Evergreen Garden has been on my list ever since I drove by it on my way to hit up the taco truck. It's one of those establishments that is curious for one reason or another, piques your interest and that you always mean to check out. It only took me a few years but I finally stopped by for some weekend pho action the other day. 
The patio at this place is an awesome place to sit on a sunny day and ignore the going ons of the world. It's enclosed and in the middle of 2 restaurant rooms. Random posters of polar bears and people doing yoga near crashing waves mingle with more typical Asian art and white xmas lights on the walls. The roof of the patio is covered in corrugated transparent plastic that lets in the sun. They've attached  large fabric umbrellas to the beams of the roof at regular intervals. A variety of plants, the swaying umbrellas and the peaceful air about this place make it a quiet Vietnamese food oasis in the strangest of spots.
The food is all serviceable. I enjoyed the spicy beef noodle soup with rare steak and a good kick. The wonton noodle soup with egg noodles, chicken, shrimp, and veggies was a ton of food. The broccoli was fresh, the shrimps tasted good, the chicken was white (I'll say no more), but I could do without the crinkle cut carrot pieces. The wontons tasted home made, but had a bit too much vinegary tang to the pork filling. Rice paper wrapped spring rolls with peanut sauce were good, as was the fresh oj. The menu is extensive and runs the gamut of Thai and some Chinese noodle, rice, and stir fry dishes as well as Vietnamese items. 
The patio is so pleasant that it's easy to overlook the less than perfect food, and I can see myself wasting away the day there, drinking beers with friends and snacking on app.s or other simple fare. Service is nice and aims to please.
author: Candice L.

description: I love that a pho restaurant is within walking distance to my house.  I don't love the fact that it's never open when I really need a bowl of pho (Sunday morning - best hangover cure).  I finally ventured out to try it on a Monday night.  The pho tai was dry, but still edible.  At least everything felt clean in there (unlike most pho restaurants).  The service was fantastic, and knowing me, I'd go back for the convenience factor.  Please just open on Sundays!
author: Jenny L.

description: Food was pretty tasting and super fast. It also has a nice vegetarian selection. I just wish there were more veggies and less pho noodles.
author: Nader A.

description:
one star for close to work +

one star for being super quick with take-out and dine-in orders+

one star for super yummy imperial roll salad that makes me homesick for cilantro in cincinnati (http://www.yelp.com/biz/cilantro-vietnamese-bistro-cincinnati) +

one star for the super-fresh fortune cookie last time i dined-in=

four stars!
author: Katherine R.

description: In an effort to be more adventurous, I have started ordering my pho with tendons and tripe. I ordered their number 2 pho as my introduction to these, and I really liked it! The broth itself wasn't as good as some other pho places I've been to (hence the 4 stars) but it's still impressive to me. This place actually made me decide that I need to try as many different pho places as possible.
author: Darren M.

description: It's okay. I kept on finding hair in my pad-thai... I know right. exactly. As I was thinking too. there was like 2 peices. LOL. We sat outside for our meal, the spring rolls, eh. It was alright but I had it everyday already so no complains. Didn't order pho, but com tom... which is the rice plate. the chicken was dried. Decided I didn't want to share anymore so I just ate my pad thai. :] Oh and I was eating, a fly came into my food. GREAT ONE. T__T so i killed it with my water and drowned it kinda........ not really it still flew away. So in the end, the mint part was my fave. (:
author: Carolyn Y.

description: the beef carpaccio is bomb and their banh xeo is HUGE. minus one star for the nasty white wine but i guess i can't expect fine wine at a vietnamese joint.
author: Jennifer Y.

description: We had raw beef salad (beef, jalapenos, peanuts and lemon juice), vietnamese crepes (bun xieu), spring and egg rolls. They do the whole production with lettuce wraps with herbs, pickled veggies and dipping sauce. Love this place and totally would go back especially on a warm night. Actually compared to most Vietnamese restaurant this place feels spacious and there's lots of parking.
author: Steve B.

description: I keep going to Evergreen Garden because it is close to my apartment, but I can't say it's really worth making a trip.The ownership semi-recently changed; the food and presentation really have improved. The people there are very nice, you'll never have to wait for a dinner table, and the motley decorations are endearing. They have a pretty extensive menu. My top veggie pick is the vegetarian vermicelli salad that comes with imperial rolls on top. Usually it has a good quantity of fresh herbs. The fresh rolls have thinly sliced freshly fried tofu, rice noodles, and lettuce, and come with a peanut sauce. The texture is great but I would prefer more herbs.
author: Amy E.

description: I just re-discovered this place after 10 years. It's under new management, but it's still a fantastic place for cheap vietnamese vittles!  A classic like Tu Lan or Sam Wo's, but much less greasy. Super accommodating, very nice staff. Brought in 20 people with me last week for lunch. The place was terribly busy, but they managed to seat us within 10mins. Pho, Pho, Pho! Nearly all dishes can be easily split between two people. It has a covered indoor-outdoor patio thing going, great place on those rare indian summer days.
author: rebecca z.

description: Plain and simple, straightforward Vietnamese food; absolutely delicious food for the price and location. No more long drives to Daly City for Pho, Evergreen Gardens has what we love.
author: Zee R.

description: Uber-casual and cheap, Evergreen is a good bet when you want yummy eats in a low key environment without a wait or any Mission hipster vibe. Sounds refreshing right? The bulk of the menu is Vietnamese but they have some Thai dishes which are quite good too. Bun, pho, veggies - whatever your desire, they do it well here.
author: Aimee G.

description: Good, cheap Vietnamese food located on Harrison as you transition from downtown to the Mission -- perfect location.
author: Tim G.

description: I came here for the first time a while back with a friend and I really wanted to like the place, especially as I'd been craving vietnamese food all day.  Our waitress was friendly and fast, after taking our order, we received our entrees in like 1 minute.  However, she completely forgot that we ordered spring rolls - not a fan of that considering that as a waitress, remembering people's orders is an integral part of your job!  The restaurant was pretty empty as well so it wasn't as if she was being overwhelmed with guests.  And despite the speediness of its arrival, I was very underwhelmed by my dish, vermicelli with imperial rolls & bbq pork.  I felt like the portions were rather meager, the pork was bland and flavorless, the beansprouts were limp, not crunchy like they should be and the noodles were nothing to write home about which is sad considering - how hard is it to mess up vermicelli?  Also the basil that came with it was limp and clearly not fresh and had very little flavor - one of the things I love most about vietnamese restaurants is the fresh and fragrant basil... but not at this place.  Furthermore, the bowl was practically 1/4th lettuce - not a good sign.  The salty lemonade I ordered was okay but nothing I'd order again, not here at least.  My friend's pho did not look like anything special either.  Nothing seemed fresh.  Lastly, I had to flag down our waitress to get our check, I don't like having to do that.  I like the ambiance of this place but it would take a lot to convince me to come back, this was definitely one of the least satisfying experiences I've ever had at a vietnamese restaurant.
author: Suzanne V.

description: What this place lacks in ambiance, it makes up for in grilled pork.  Last time I ate here I was blown away by a big bowl of soup with a generous portion of noodles and tender, perfectly seasoned pork, accompanied by a plate of fresh, fragrant basil, crunchy sprouts and a wedge of lime.  Fresh, satisfying and delicious.  The menu includes a selection of Chinese-style dishes which, while not their strong suit, are not bad.
author: Jennifer N.

description: The pork/shrimp salad rocks here - very nice folks - always good service!
author: sHoo o.

description: Great sitting area outside; it was especially pleasant on a nice Sunday morning. Their food is decent, but the broth for their pho a little salty for my taste.
author: Janie Y.

description: Been here a few times and it's starting to grow on me. Pho is good, not amazing. But definitely a good eat!
author: Gregory D.

description: I live near Evergreen, and I only recently started going. I've been a couple of times so far, and each time was a good experience. The pho is good- lighter and less-oily than a lot of places, which is just how I like it. The summer rolls and peanut sauce are also nice. This is, of course, not gourmet dining, but it's a good place for a cheap meal.
author: Nicole J.

description:
I come with my missus, for a no fuss meal . Its simple, affordable and most importantly tasty Vietnamese fare. I rarely order anything but the vermicelli and BBQ pork, which is constantly a winner.
The staff are always very freindly and helpful.
Parking is easy in the area.
author: Ad C.

description:
damn good food. quiet, good food service. casual, and laid back. DAMN good Pho. yum.


mix it up!
author: Gabe B.

description: This place is pretty tasty, I really like everything i get from here and there are good condiments on the tables. the patio has a very relaxing atmosphere. you should go here it's good and quick for lunch if you work in the area. lots of variety if you are a vego too.
author: melissa h.

description: I came here a couple of time for lunch with co-workers.  The food is so-so but decent price and portion.
author: L C.

description: Great pho tai (noodle soup with rare beef) and bun thit nuong (barbecue pork atop vermicelli noodle salad with the yummy chili-vinegar sauce! I love the friendly staff, too!
author: Sharman G.

description: Five spice chicken is soo good,and the serve thai dishes
author: Avery H.

description: Just went there for the first time, for lunch on a sunny day.  My new business is near there, so I wanted to check it out.  Had the #1pho combo, which was very good.  Not excellent, but very good.  My friend had #17, seafood with a kind of hot and sour broth.  Also very good.  The outdoor patio is charming and and service was excellent.
author: Elizabeth M.

description: Very friendly service.  The older man that seems to run the patio was constantly giggling and ready for anything - including our indecision.  The chicken with basil and peppers over rice looked and smelled great, and my beef pho was good too.  I can't say the same thing about the salty lemonade though... I guess it's a local thing.  I would definitely go back when the sun is out.
author: Kiren L.

description: delicious spring rolls and kind staff. also speedy and reasonably priced.
author: P L.

description: I love the curry fake chicken dish they have here-- it's great to find veggie-friendly vietnamese-- that tastes good! i'd give them 5 stars if they delivered outside the mission area.
author: Geri K.

description: if your in sf right now :( this feeling should be mutual. today is  the day for some free delivery PHO!!! evergreen is the local spot to go for all types of Vietnamese food...on days not like today they have the outdoor patio which gets you a nice sunny feeling while enjoy some crispy imperial rolls!!
author: Corwin C.

description: i was pleasantly surprised by this place.  i've walked by it many times and finally went in.  the decor is certainly charm free, but the food was fresh and good.  that and we sat outside on a nice day.  perhaps i should try it again in the fog, but for the moment, i'm a fan.
author: sarah b.

description: it's the best pho in the city. just eat here. you'll see....
author: Sarah T.

description: I go here for lunch a lot because its close to my house and some things on the menu are really good.  I pretty much always get number 32 (vermicelli with bbq chicken and imperial rolls).  If I am feeling wild I will get a iced vietnamese coffee which has a similar to snorting meth
author: Cody R.

description: for the basics, this place is great for the price. good value. the imperial rolls with the lettuce, mint, and noodles are super and the veggie salad with tofu is nice. stay away from the spicy basil chicken - serves me right ordering a thai dish at a vietnamese place...really. i should have known better. good, casual, cheap place to get some vietnamese, easy parking is a plus.
author: Hilary H.

description: Just okay.  Why can't it be as good as his father's old Golden Flower place, since they even moved the workers here.  Need the old man, goodness knows what happened to him.  Only if I was in the area; out of the way for me.
author: e g.

description: Went there tonight because we were searching for a cheap place around SFGH that wasn't too ghetto. (Fiance is a med student on a rotation at the "General" or "El Generale" as they call it). In any case, drove past this place, had a parking spot right in front, so we decided to try it. Had the veggie fresh spring rolls (very good - always judge a place by their spring rolls and the price, which at $5.50 for 4 big pieces wasn't bad!), pad thai- was wondering if this was vietnamese or not but oh well - which was pretty good. fiance had the chicken vermicelli dish and vietnamese coffee which he liked. Service was nothing remarkable and decor gets thumbs down. But pretty good for a quick meal and comparable to the Sunflower Cafe in the Mission, but way less crowded, don't have the deal with the crazy waiter there and much more mellow experience.
author: M B.

description: evergreen garden is rad cause its right across from work . the bbq pork soup is on hit .
author: d l.

description: barely edible. i can't imagine what folks who gave it a five star eat? perhaps i ordered the wrong dish, but never before have noodles been so BAD. and not cheap either. if cheap at least i can say, hey at least i didn't waste a lot of money. but it was like $8-9 ...not cheap! AND BAD. overcooked, poor taste, bad quality. old food. yuck! i'd rather go hungry.
author: shanestar h.

description: I love this place.. I go once a week for lunch and it's consistently amazingly good.  Try the Pho Tai and the #30 with Pork... yum.  The Vietnamese spring rolls are so fresh... my mouth is watering just writing this review.  I wonder if they're open today (new years day) for lunch.
author: H G.

description: Really like their crepe and chicken salad.  Usually order for delivery (very prompt).  Good quality food.  The beef noodle soup (pho) has good flavor and a decent size.  The servers are very nice and food comes out very quickly.  Easy parking and plenty of seating.  Overall a good place to go for Vietnamese food.
author: Ai M.

description:
After a hard day of climbing at Mission Cliffs, I'm ravenous. Sweaty, ravenous, usually a bit chalky. But the folks here never blink an eye. And, as chalkily ravenous as I may be, my Vietnamese food fanaticism still makes me pay close, careful attention to my food. And the food here is usually so good, homey, and spot on that I can simply sit back and enjoy the flavors. Ty, one of the owners, was awesome. A bit soul-weary, I found myself looking at a calendar on the wall, with some words in Vietnamese. Intrigued, I asked him to translate. By the time my to go order was ready, I had some insightful Buddhist philosophy uplifting my spirit -- words about waves and kites, nature and nurture, and I left the restaurant armed with  a fragrantly heady batch of noodles and a smile. Who knew that a little Vietnamese restaurant hidden in one tiny corner of the Mission could be heaven for the tummy and the soul? 

Sometimes, you find gorgeous experiences in unexpected places. Time and time again, I find them here.
author: han p.

description: Great little jem in the Mission, cool patio on a nice sunny day, usually never crowded.   My fav is the Hot and Sour soup with either Tofu or Chicken.
author: John Z.

description: food tastes good, but made my stomach hurt more than once. not worth the suffering.
author: Joel O.
